messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:57): only 12 messages overnight on public-html‚Ä¶ the traffic is really going down

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:59): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 - please don't talk about it. If you mention that, it'll jinx it and next thing you know we'll have a new thread about the indeting style of the source for the spec
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: or worse ‚Äî versioning.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:00): we need a FAQ really
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:00): a preemptive FAQ
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:01): "Please no versioning discussion ... please if you think the we should force authors to write only in valid XML, find another place to discuss it ... " etc.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:02): if you want x, y, z see public-xhtml2
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:03): it's amazing how many people on public-html have a view that goes against what is in-scope for this WG, and is in-scope for XHTML2

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:03): Or to put it another way, "These topics have been discussed at great length already, and it's not likely that whatever you might have to say about it is going change the worlds and magically bring everything to a resolution"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:04): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 - yeah
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:04): Or, to put it in another way again, "STFU."
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:05): anyway, amazing to me that people don't see that you can author in whatever language you want and transform your content to HTML
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:05): can create your own perfect authoring language that exactly meets whatever criteria you have
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:06): and then try to convince others to use that for authoring if you want
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:06): but it does not need to be directly supported in browsers
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:06): phew! document.title was insane
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:08): reads cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 message on document.title
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:12): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: what do you expect? it's HTML!
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:13): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: oh sure :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:13): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - so current spec doesn't match behavior of any current browser?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:14): my proposal doesn't either, but is closer
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:15): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:15): it's great to be getting these detailed spec reviews posted to public-html
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:16): I think a side effect of it'l be to try to set higher expectations about what't appropriate for the list
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:19): and encourage others to do detailed reviews

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:20): I think at some point we need to take a hard look at what has actually been accomplished by having a W3C working group participating in work on the HTML5 spec that might not have been accomplished by having the discussion take place only on the WHATWG list
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:21): but not sure what we can point to so far as far as that goes
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:21): headers="" research
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:22): OK, true that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:23): I think another anticipated benefit of having discussion within a W3C context was that it would facilitate and encourage participation from Microsoft ...
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:25): currently at 1212 tests for #numbers
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:25): still parts of the algorithm not tested, though
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:25): *algorithms
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:26): man, if we keep up this rate, we will have 20,000 tests at 2010 for sure
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:27): that doesn't mean we will have complete implementations though

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:27): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: what I'm doing for the numbers is a massive advantage for the numbers though: use each test input data for each number algorithm
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:27): (which massively increases the amount of invalid input, and checking of the error handling)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:30): ok, document.body is next

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:31): likes the fact that Bungie still cares about those who don't use Windows (insofar as they make sure their site works on Safari, they encode many videos in MPEG standards as well as WMV, etc.)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:34): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: good stuff on the list
